item.title: Quotebook
item.description: Literature The fact we live at the bottom of a deep gravity well, on the surface of a gas covered planet going around a nuclear fireball 90 million miles away and think this to be normal is obviously some indication of how skewed or perspective tends to be. — Douglas Adams still couldn’t accept that meaning and solace aren’t to be found on the heavens but in the tranches of everyday living
